Hi everyone,
 
We’ll be broadcasting another hour-long
  special edition of the CBS Evening News tonight from the campus of Virginia
  Tech, where President Bush and the first lady today joined students, faculty
  and the extended university community in mourning the dozens who died in
  yesterday’s horrifying massacre. 
 
Bob Orr will tell you more about Cho Seung-Hui, the
  23-year-old English major responsible for killing 32 people before turning a
  gun on himself. Officials haven’t yet put together a full picture of
  Cho, saying only that “he was a loner.” But there are some clues
  that might shed light on his motivation, and we’ll share those with
  you.
 
The identities of the victims are still being
  released, but it is already clear that Cho’s bullets cut across a diverse
  swatch of the campus population. The dead range from bright college freshmen
  to a 76-year-old internationally renowned engineering professor. Cynthia Bowers
  will bring you portraits of those murdered.
 
Also, Sharyn Alfonsi will report on what happened in
  the critical two hours when Cho eluded police.
 
Thalia Assuras will chronicle the grieving process
  on campus.
 
And our technology correspondent, Daniel Sieberg,
  will take a look at social networking online in the wake of the tragedy.
 
I hope you’ll join us tonight, and be sure to
  tune in at 10 p.m. EST to a special edition of 48 Hours this evening called
  “Anatomy of a Rampage.” 
 
Thanks,
 




Katie Couric
CouricandCo@cbs.com
